column4: Excuse me, I've been hacking away for hours trying to get my monitor's resolution to be correctly recognized. This just recently happened, Can someone help?
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: S3 Inc. VT8375 [ProSavage8 KM266/KL266]
I'm trying to remember what I had to do with mine I had an old pc with one of those.
I think the s3 driver was blacklisted on default ubuntu installe
Take your time, I've been at this for hours. :'(
let me do some searching hold up
also I found a thread discussing the 9.10 issue
Thanks, I'm just baffled as to why this happened a week after installing. It was working fine at 1280x1024 resolution before..
upgrade to one of the X packages probably
you could try rolling back if you figure otu which package.  most like xserver-video-s3 or somethign like that.
you may have the old package in /var/cache/apt/archives/
Wow, the forum thread you sent me is the EXACT same thing that's happening too me. Even the same distro.
